cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 315 miles SE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest late Sunday, then north-northwest Monday while crossing western Cuba and entering the eastern Gulf of Mexico, aiming toward the west-central Florida coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast (near or just north of Tampa Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch – Cayman Islands; Tropical Storm Watch – Jamaica
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Jamaica, Cayman Islands, western Cuba, Florida Keys, and the Florida peninsula including the west-central coast
weather_observation.wind: 34-kt (gale) winds probability rises rapidly after 72 h with up to 65 % chance overall; 50-kt winds up to 33 % by 5 days; hurricane-force gusts possible if Ian nears the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Increasing risk (mid-week) of life-threatening storm surge exceeding 3 ft in and around Tampa Bay if Ian tracks close to the coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 in of rainfall in the Tampa Bay region late Tuesday through Thursday with flash/urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents; possible port access restrictions, limited visibility in heavy squalls, and berth/anchorage congestion.
